newsitem.title: UK: Baltic, Black Sea oil exports rose 95K bpd on week.
newsitem.headline: Baltic, Black Sea oil exports rose 95K bpd on week.

text.p: Oil exports from Baltic and Black Sea terminals rose 95,797 barrels per day bpd) in the fourth week of February to 1.694 million bpd, Petro-Logistics said.
But total exports were 336,874 bpd higher than the same week last year despite falls in gas oil and gasoline/jet exports.

The Geneva-based consultancy, tracking tanker movements, said crude exports from Baltic and Black Sea ports rose 194,109 bpd on the week to 1.01 million bpd. This was just a modest 16,394 bpd rise over the same week last year.
Gas oil exports fell 77,555 bpd to 386,367 bpd but were still 56,694 bpd higher than last year. Heavy fuel exports rose 16,413 bpd to 279,766 bpd and were higher by 205,493 bpd over last year.
Gasoline and jet exports combined totalled 46,323 bpd, down 46,323 bpd on the week but still 25,844 bpd higher than last year.
The following table provided by Petro-Logistics lists a breakdown in metric tonnes of petroleum exports from the Baltic and Black Sea in the fourth week of February.
